developmental_risk_block.text: Developmental risk is flagged due to limited adolescent data and uncertain long-term effects. Endocrine, growth, neurodevelopmental, and metabolic setpoints may be sensitive to perturbation. This section is descriptive only; uncertainty is explicitly acknowledged.

changelog.summary: Initial canonical entry for Brain Natriuretic Peptide
changelog.detail: Generated from queue ingestion (Phase 6). Requires human-authored, evidence-bounded content.

practical.bottom_line: Brain natriuretic peptide (BNP) is a natural heart hormone used clinically as a biomarker in heart failure evaluation. It is not a wellness peptide. External BNP affects blood pressure and fluid balance and can cause dangerous hypotension.
benefits: clinical relevance as a heart-failure biomarker (BNP/NT-proBNP)
physiology relevance in natriuresis and vascular tone regulation
side_effects_serious: dangerous low blood pressure symptoms (confusion, collapse)
signs of electrolyte imbalance (severe weakness, palpitations)
who_should_be_cautious: people with low blood pressure or on vasodilators/blood pressure meds
people with kidney disease or unstable fluid balance
adolescents (high consequence plus limited context for use)
